intro: Eremophila scaberula, commonly known as the rough eremophila, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is a member of the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its shrub-like growth habit. The plant features narrow, hairy leaves and produces spikes of small, tubular flowers in shades of pink to red. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it drought-tolerant. Eremophila scaberula is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in harsh conditions.
